modules.description: Generates Dockerfile content using OCaml types, supporting instructions like `FROM`, `RUN`, `COPY`, and `CMD`. It works with custom data types representing each Dockerfile directive and their arguments. Used to automate image creation in CI pipelines, ensuring reproducible build steps through type-safe composition.

The module provides tools to construct and modify Dockerfile instructions, including concatenating fragments, adding comments, and handling BuildKit syntax and heredoc content, while operating on structures like paths, environment variables, and image configurations. It enables configuring container behavior through directives such as CMD, EXPOSE, and ENV, along with advanced features like mount points, health checks, and layer optimization, supporting precise control over image construction and runtime settings.
